text: 50 cl bottle poured in to a Weizen glass. Clear golden colour with a huge white head that slowly fades to a fat cap on top. Sweet aroma with grasses, banana, wheat malts and spicy notes. Pepper. Taste is light bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes drying and fruity with grasses and spices. An okay kristallweizen, drier and more bitter than the regular weizen.

Bottle at Main Strand by Frankfurt Brooklyn Bridge. Pours bright golden amber with a medium sized white head. Aroma of wheat, corn, citrus, hop, grass and vaguely reminiscent of hubba bubba. Medium plus sweetness, with moderate but slightly tart bitterness. Light to medium body, slightly watery texture, with above average carbonation at least initially. Finish is semi-sweet and lemony.

Bottle. Pale colour, clear, frothy head that does not stay long, almost no lacing. Aroma is malt, corn, grassy hops, matches. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation, light body. Tastes more like a German pils than a wheat. A bit too flat for me.
0.5l bottle from hieber. pours a clear pale golden with a medium dense white head. aroma of grains, yeast, candy, honey, banana. flavour of mineral water, citrus, wheat, grass. salty.

Appearance: Clear golden, some fizzy white head.
Aroma: Light fruits, citrus, wheat, slight metal.
Taste: Wheat, slight citrus, light hops. Refreshing.
Bought: Edeka (Konstanz), 500 ml, 0.98
Info: 15/4-2017, BB: 31/10-2017

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Couleur dorée claire, légère mousse. Nez leger malt doux et levures. Gout leger malté et levures avec note de fruité banane. Corps moyen. Fin legere douce et metal. Vraiment rien de spécial...

getränkemarkt oberkirch

Una Kritallweizen de color dorado, baja carbonatacion y media espuma. Su aroma es a trigo y Malta. Su sabor refrescante, cremoso, Malta, trigo y agua. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[backlog] 04-11-15 / 500ml bottle. Boring Kristall. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 2.25/5

Bottle at home. Pours crystal clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is moderate cereal and earthy wheat malt, light banana esters and spicy cloves. Flavor is moderate earthy wheat malt, light banana esters, clove phenols and citrus tartness with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Banana, hop, yeast in aroma
Spicy
Bitterness with sweet

Good beer.

(Kiev 2016) 500 ml. bottle sampled. BBF 25.06.2016. Pours clear (check!) golden, little white head. Nose is dull oily cardboard, low vegetable, sweet sugar, rather bland, low white bread. Taste is fizzy bland sugar, low rather inoffensive vegetable notes, low carboard, white bread. Very bland & inoffensive overall (I did get a Kristallweizen in the end  yes I basically got it for the rare style tick), touch too much cardboard & low vegetable notes for me to really love, it is drinkable for sure.

500 ml bottle. Pours crystal clear yellow colour. 2 finger steady creamy egg-shell white head. Stays. Drops slowly till a thin thick foamy layer on the brew surface. Aroma: green fresh hops, herbal, clove, field flowers, a hint of banana. Taste: hop extract, herbs, carnation, minerals, clove. Lively carbonation. Moderate long bitter finish. Well, this beer is like a hopped helles. Not a hint of a wheat beer.

Bottle from Trinkgut in Kleve or Goch, not for sure. The beer is clear golden colored and has a small white head, with average carbonation. 
The aroma has notes of hops and malts, but also a little spicy bitterness and a little fruitiness from citrus. 
The taste is malty and light sweet and light bodied, and has further a little watery texture. Some notes from the aroma are noticable. 
The finish is refreshing and light bitter and a little metallic. 
Well drinkable, but I prefer a normal Weizen.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear gold. Nose: lemon, hay, yeast. Taste follows nose with added banana and cloves. Dry finish.
Klares goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Weizenmalz, Karamell, fruchtig, Banane, Zitrus, sehr spritzig.
Bottle. 500ml 0,87 . Skaidrus, grai, neilgai iliekanti puta ...geras skonis
500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aromas of banana, cereal grains, bread yeast. Taste is more of the same, clean finish. Not bad, but not great either.

Rated from old notes. Pours clear and golden, like a pilsener. Well carbonated. Very mild banana aroma. The taste of the wheat malt is very subdued. This is not an assertive beer, no surprises here good or bad. May be a nice intro for someone not really into wheat beer, but personally I would prefer a good Hefeweizen any day.

Flasche 0,5l: Helles Gold, klar, keine Perlen, kein Schaum(!); angenehme Nase, dezent, leichte Frische, Zitrusaromen, etwas Malz, Hefearomen; dezente Bitterkeit, leichte Hopfennoten, keine Kohlensäure, dadurch sehr fade, überhaupt nicht spritzig, dezente Süße, etwas Grapefruitzest; trockener Nachgang --> die Flasche scheint aufgrund der fehlenden Kohlensäure fehlerhaft zu sein --> nochmals probieren/bewerten

Bottle @The Pond, Leith. Pours golden clear and a slight white head. Nose has more banana than the hefe, bread yeast, caramel and a slight bubblegum nose. Taste is very much like the nose, i prefer this to the hefe.
Aroma is yeasty, mostly bananas. High carbonated, fruity weizen. Low bitterness. Very drinkable.

A German, golden kristallweizen with white head. Aroma is malty, yeasty, fresh fruity. Taste is light bitter sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drinking from tab. 
In the aroma hop and malt. 
The clear golden beer has a medium white head. 
In the taste a nice bitterness, spices, hop. 
Medium carbonated.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Bazaar Yishkon. Thanks Cris for this bottle. Clear gold. Mild fruity esters aroma with a spicy note, some grassy hops notes. Slightly sweetish flavor with light fruitiness, some phenolic spiciness, and a bitterish finish with some grassy hops. Light-bodied. Not fruity enough, and too bitter for the style.

Aroma of floral hops, wheat, wheat malt, bread, toast and yeast. Pours clear golden liquid with a big white head. Medium bitterness and sweetness, the initial taste is bitter hops, which is surprising for a Weizen, but it follows up with a sweet wheat and banana flavour. Not a lot of other flavours, but some herbs and spices, as well as some citrus notes. Medium body with an oily texture, very drinkable and lively carbonation.

Bottle at The Adlon, Berlin. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of light fruits, grain, light malt and soft fruity hops. Flavour is above light sweet and bitter. Above light bodied with moderate carbonation.

Bottle, Siegessaule, Berlin. Bright unexcited gold with a modest white top. Nose of standard banana and bubblegum esters. Lemon puff biscuit base slivered with unripe banana and cinnamon spice. Lick of wet cardboard as it deadens. Quenching wheat-lager hybrid leaning towards US wheat in profile. Digging the absence of agonising stomach cramps: bonus point.
0.5 l bottle from Rewe, Eschborn. Clear yellow-golden color, good head. Interesting citrus aroma, for a Kristallweizen not bad. Nice little bit metallic ending.
Bottle @ home. Clear golden color, average sized white to off-white head. Smell and taste wheat, lightly herbs or spices, slightly banana, yeast. Average body and carbonation. Not bad.

Aparência límpida,brilhante,coloração amarelo palha,espuma alta,abundante e duradoura;aroma dentro do estilo apresentando banana,cravo,aveia,fermento,é notado a presença de uma leve acidez cítrica;sabor acompanha o aroma,porem mais suave e adocicado;corpo leve,refrescante,alta carbonação,boa drinkability.
Amazing beer! Wherever you are, find this German import, you will be very pleased. I drink it daily, chilled.

500 ml bottle, from CITTI-Markt Flensburg. ABV is 5.0%. BB date 03.14. Golden colour, moderate white head. Fairly fresh aroma, moderate notes of banana and cloves. The flavour is quite dry and refreshing, only very moderate notes of banana and cloves, the hops are more distinct than in most weissbiers.

Had two 500mls, cold from fridge 4 degrees C. Aroma is pleasant but not overly strong - particularly when sitting under a 3 to 4 finger head. Pours beautifully lightly golden / straw coloured in a Weizen glass (630ml glass for a 500ml bottle) with the head coming just over the top of the glass without spilling. If using another type of glass beware it is highly carbonated. Head does hang around like a wiezen should, but dissipates more quickly than some of the competing brands. Limited lacing which is why the appearance is a 4. 
Taste is spot on for a Kristall Weizen - Refreshing with only a hint of bitterness, slightly less flavour than a hefe. I struggle to separate the different flavours - but that is a reflection on me rather than the beer. 
Plate is medium short - but again typical of the style. 
This was a gift of a six pack from a friend. Would certainly purchase myself, although Weihenstephaner is still my favourite in this style so far, this is a very nice beer.
Cor dourado claro, translúcida. Espuma boa e de média persistência. Aroma e paladar de banana. Corpo leve.
Pours a sparkling clear pale amber with a foamy white head. Sweet yeasty aroma. Flavours are caramel, banana and spice. Bitterness is just noticeable. Has a medium mouthfeel.
Fine beer. Not a whole lot to say about it. It was tasty. Character limit booooooooooo
0.5 l bottle. Crystal-clear straw yellow color. Aroma: phenol, spicy, wheat. Taste: fruit (banana) with spicy notes, a bit of tartness.

500ml bottle shared with my wife. Aromas of banana and caramel. Clear pale amber with tall white head. A few bubbles streaming up the glass. Medium body but very flat on the tongue. Aftertaste is long with hints of hop bitterness, cloves and a touch of banana sweetness. Not the best Ive ever had but OK for the style.

Did I just trade for 7 kristalweizens you bet I did. Pours bright yellow with big sudsy white head. Nose is sour wheat and banana. Tastes very wheaty, of banana, bubblegum, grains, and touch metallic. Crisp palate light off flavors on finish.

A la pression dans un restaurant Viet-Namien à Berlin.
Malheureusement servie avec un citron vert, tout étant faussé...:(
Limpide, smoothy... voilà tout ce que je peux juger...
Cleat yellow golden color with medium head. Aroma is wheat. Flavor is wheat, malt. Pretty basic filtered hefe.
Transparent Yellow color. Refreshing easy to drink beer. Very light in smell and taste. Enjoyable and forgetable.

This is kind of the Pilsner of wheat beers. Solid spice and bubblegum. Clove and a hint of pepper. A bit of malt in the back. But compared to a standard hefe this is a much smoother brew and easier to gulp down if thats what you are in for. Decent.

Bottle from some off licence near to the Well and Bucket in Shoreditch. I bought this and then tried to stumble into the Well and Bucket, until the bouncer kindly asked me to hand my swag in to the bar, so that the bar staff could keep it safe for me. Which I did. Im drinking it now. Its quite nice really, with bubblegum and liquid banane, all around the mouth centre. Fairly refreshing.
Bottled; Damn nice ; Maybe a tad sugary but otherwise clean and very easy to sink, Loads of firm banana notes , dry spicy , sweet through out ; Look, this way better than these scores given.

Bottle; pours clear gold with a white head; sweet malt aroma with a hint of spice; taste is slightly sweet with malt and some hints of banana and pepper; a bit thin and watery with very little bitterness
Bottle. Clear golden pour with a huge frothy head. Candy banana, spices, some toasted malts and some earthy notes.

Filtered version of Schöfferhofer Hefeweizen with cream white, thick head and pure golden blonde colour, cristal clear with fierce sparkling. Sweetish pale malts and subtle wheat sourishness, apple, cloves, flowers. Taste of pale malts with a fresh, gentle wheat sourishness and some apply fruitiness, very light hop bitterishness in the finish. Straightforward but thirst-quenching.
Clear gold, medium white head. Odd aroma, light yeast and... soap? Bitterness with sweet undertones and some spicy-fruity notes. Good bitter-ish finish. I like this one.
A very refreshing summer beer best sampled with a slice of lemon (Im told).
Poured from 500mL bottle. Clear, pale yellow with white head. Predominant corn aroma, malty taste, not too watery, but still light-medium body.
(On tap in Stralsund, 2014). Slightly tart aroma and taste of citrus and wheat. Dry finish with some hints of yeast.
50cl bottle at Ampelman, Berlin. Clear yellow with a white head. Mild wheaty aroma with hints of bananas and yeast. Mild flavours, quite boring, but a bit refreshing.
Bottle 0.5l from Delhaize Maxi store Belgrade Serbia.Pour it golden colour with medium white head.Taste and aroma of banana, malt and yeast.Ok for commercial beer.
Fruity aroma with honey tones. Clear golden colour with good head. Great fruity flavor. Very light body with high carbonation.

Hazy pale yellow color. Medium white head. Mild banana nose. Aroma is banana and water. Watery texture, thin to medium body, soft carbonation. Watery version of Hefeweizen. 
(0,5l bottle)

BB 20.06.15. Poured a clear golden colour with a 3+ finger white foamy head - far too much head for a gentle pour. Head retained quite a while but then collapsed. Laced poorly. Carbonation moderate and fine. Aroma subtly of cloves. Taste light cloves with a hint of yeast. Light body. Slightly metallic in the mouth. Long light clovey finish.
Pours clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is wheat with notes of banana, a bit metallic taste.

Bottle at OReillys Frankfurt. It pours clear golden with a thick white head. The nose is doughy, wheat, straw, banana.....not much else. The taste is sweetish, dough, banana bread, odd spiciness, sweet apple, plastic and cereal with a dry, somewhat sweet finish. Kind of artificial. Medium body and moderate+ carbonation. A bit sweet and tepid. I would prefer meth to this.

Pours a finger and half of head on a clear light straw colored body.
The aroma is a nice wheat smell with some notes of banana.
The flavor is weak. A little metallic, inappropriate bitterness in the middle. Wanders.
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
The taste was a letdown.

OLD NOTES NOV 26, 2003 Quite a strong malty smell in the bottle. Poured quite a fluffy head with a carbonated body. Quite a wheaty flavour, with what I could describe as a fruity bitterness at the end. A very interesting beer to my palate, especially for one as clear, clean and crisp. I think I could enjoy more of these considering the price I got this 500ml bottle for.
500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldgelbes Bier, viel CO2, viel Schaum. Geruch hefig, leicht malzig fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, im Abgang leicht würzig.
A clear golden beer with a small foam head, malt flavor with some weath characteristics, but at the end nothing special. Medium body and good hops malt balance.

På fat. Hälls upp guldfärgad med stort vitt skum. Doftar banan, citron och örter. Smakinslag av banan, citron, vete, och vitt bröd. Kolsyrig munkänsla. Torr avslutning. Lättdrucken, men blir något metallisk i längden.
A normal and simple kristallweizen. It is light and refreshing. Good at a summer day.

500ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average, foamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Wheat malty, minimally bready aroma, a touch of lemongrass. Taste is dry, pale malty, minimally wheaty and strawy; slightly prickling carbonation. Nothing special, but theres not much more in this style anyway.
Bottle 50cl. White layer sticks to the sides. Clear color. Aroma of wheat, malt, yeast and banana. Taste is same with an even stronger banana.

Bottle 0,5l at Kieler Brauerei, Germany. Pours a golden colour. Medium size thick white head. Metallic, sweetish, malty and dirty banana in aroma. Watery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma clássico de cerveja de trigo, porém o sabor já se mistura com o amargor do lúpulo, que se nota claramente no retrogosto. No geral é suave como uma cerveja de trigo deve ser, com bom amargor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A clear golden weizen with a thin white head. In aroma, light fruity malt with faint notes of banana, not bad. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light banana and chalky character, a bit light but great for Paraguay weather. Bottle at Lo de Osvaldo, for about 4.50$ (20000 guaranis).

.5l bottle from Aroma market in Belgrade. Clean, nice clear orange with thin head. Sweet alc lager aroma with tart wheat-malt aroma. Crisp body, some sweet corn and fruity wheat. Tart finish but muddled flavors. Crisp example of style, and interesting to have around
Bottle at home thanks to pussypete. Pours a clear golden wheat color with a white head. Flavor is bitter and grainy, not bad. Crisp as fuck

Bottle @ Gregs palace. Thanks to Baron for this Wheat Whale. Pours a fairly clear golden yellow appearance with a thin off white head. Grainy, light corn, herbal, a bit citrusy aroma. Slightly tangy citrusy, banana, wheat, straw flavor. Bleh.
UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 Bottle. Clear golden, white frothy head. Retention below average. Nose of spice, banana & herbs. Sweet & bitter taste notes. Mild finish. Nice balance. Medium body. Fine.

Tap @ Bavarian Bier Cafe Moore Park. Typical clear gold with frothy white head. Aromas of banana, bread yeast and a touch of clove but it was all underwhelming. Flavours of banana, clove, grass and a slightly sour note. Nothing terribly interesting and not as good as the hefeweizen.
Pours golden, clear, with thick white head with small bubbles that dissipates quickly. Aroma is grains, banana, spices. Bitter. Not much flavor. Sticky finish.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with airy but stable white head. Clear aroma of hops, yeast and banana. Bitter and acidic flavpur of hops and citrus with a pronounced banana note, ending in a rough and grainy way with a touch of grass. OK, quite enjoyable but nothing really extraordinary.

Bottle at the Dinasty Residence, Tirana. Poured a cloudy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is weak malt and crushed banana. The flavour is yeast and loads of banana with a smooth slightly sour palate. Not a bad beer at all.

Cerveja clara. Aroma leve. Sabor de uma boa cerveja pilsen com um toque de trigo. Desce leve e refrescante!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500ml bottle. Clear golden color. Medium size thick white head. Holds nicely. Metallic, sweetish, malty and dirty banana in aroma. And the taste is same. Watery and mild banana in aftertaste.

Welch unfassbare Zeitverschwendung. Ein Helles in einem Weizengewand, das weder "sparkling" noch "bubbling over" daherkommt. Seltsam muffliges "Aroma" und absolut dumpf von Anfang bis zum Ende. Ein sehr ungewöhnliches Kristall. Ungewöhnlich schlecht.

Light milky golden colour with steady head and medium-smooth body. Nose of yeast. Taste of mild and elegant yeast, green bananas, grass, hay, cloves and dough. Easy to drink but little bit boring and dusty.

First aroma - sweet, spicy; then comes mild vanilla, sweet maltiness. But it is more hop bite in taste, herbal hopiness. Along with malty sweetness. Way too shy expression in taste. Sour finish. Medium bodied, watery mouthfeel,  mild dry finish. Pours golden to orange with white medium and fast top. Yeasty in flavor, a bit like English ale-y too. Liked that hopping level - high.
Not so good looking as the normal unfiltered weizen, this Kristall sister is more vivid and almost as good. Has less notes in the flavour but still a good clear beer.

Clear golden with quite huge white head.
Aroma.. mostly wheat and banana. yeasty. bubble gum
Moderate sweet, bit spicy and sour.
Its decent but too spicy and sour in finish. no complexity, thou no other bad aspects.
50cl - pale yellowish, very light hop extract Kristall, simplified/liquified for drinkability, not for flavour. faint banana, some evaporating citrus, light but smooth-oily palate.
(500ml bottle)  Pours a clear yellow body with a medium white head.  Aroma of cereal, grain, bread, light butter, and banana.  Flavor of bread, cereal, light citrus, and banana.
Clear lighter yellow with white foam head lacing to glass. Aroma is light citrus. Taste is light weizen citrus taste, nice and fresh. Short aftertaste, again a light weizen. (Velp 201212)
Bottle. Clear golden with tight white head. Banana ester aroma with bread. Taste of banana, metal, caramel and cereals. A poor example of a style I dont care much for.

#608
Goldgelb, klar und mit einer zwar üppigen, aber schnell verflogenen Schaumkrone. Ein nur leicht hefig-säuerliches Aroma mit fruchtigem Einschlag. Der Antrunk ist sehr spritzig, ähnlich einem Sekt. Geschmacklich leicht hefig und bananig. Für ein Kristall sind die Aromen typischerweise eher zurückhaltend. Im Abgang wirds auch erwartungsgemäß trocken. Obwohl ich ein Hefeweizen stets bevorzugen würde, läßt sich dieses Kristallweizen schnörkellos gut trinken.
	
Test vom 19.1.2010 	Noten: 10,9,10,9,10,9 - 9,30
500 ml bottle. This beer tastes spicy and bitte. Not my favourite, but its okay.
Huge white head, clear golden colour. Bitter, yet wheat-y aroma. Fruity taste, bitter palate. Nothing special.
Postupně sem budu doplňopvat piva, co jsem vypil a zapsal si, chvilku to asi bude trvat a proto k těm dříve vypitým pivům nebudou ádně "dojmy" .

0,5 l bottle at a bistro near Gendarmenmarkt. Clear sparkling golden body with a large white fluffy head. Sweet banana and spices on the nose. Medium body. Sweet, spicy and metallic. Watery but sharp from the heavy carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2012 500 ml bottle. Poured a clear amber with gold highlights and a large but dissipating white head. Clove and floral notes on the nose. Taste is classic weissbeir combo of banana, clove, orange and coriander. Perhaps let down by a rather watery body. Not as good as their hefe but not bad.

Aroma: Clean, grainy aroma.

Appearance: Clear, pale golden body with a small, white head that quickly fades. Very little lacing. 

Taste: Yeasty flavour with subtle banana and pepper notes. Slightly metallic finish. Clean flavour, but a bit bland. 

Palate: Thin body with a slightly oily texture. Prickly carbonation. 

Overall: The unfiltered version is fruitier and far superior to this.

500ml bottle from small shop in Lajes, Azores, Portugal. Pretty standard German Kristall. Notes of the clove, banana and wheat. Although very thin body still has decent flavor. Its meant for the summer times and did meet my expections.
0.5L bottle.  Big, foamy head.  Floral aroma.  Light body, almost a hefeweizen, except more bitter.  Good, not great.

Not my favorite style. Banana and bubble gum taste. Highly carbonated. Slightly unfiltered wheaty feel. Better than all the crap lagers Ive seen thus far in Seoul...in comparison to all the local competition, Id bump it up a point. Eventually Ill have to grade on a curve.

Bottle from Ninas. Pour a clear light golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, bubblegum and toffee. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation, light CO2 prickle and a foamy mouth-feel. Nice but I prefer the Hefe.

50cl bottle. Pours golden yellow with almost an oily shine to it. As expected with hefeweizen, there are steady bubbles and a generous head. The nose has vanilla cream and a note of bananas. The taste has vanilla custard with a tangy pineapple note on the end. The palate is medium bodied with a tangy texture which leads into the tangy finish. Overall., a more than solid kristal hefe.

Backlog sept 2010
Bottle in Frankfurt fair
Light body and complexity 
Ok beer, but the regular weissen is much preferable
Tap....clear golden with a small white good lasting head....The aroma is wheat, yeast and some fruits..... The flavor is nice wheat, yeast very nice fresh mouthfeel....

(Flasche) Es ist goldgelb, klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist gering, leicht süßlich-säuerlich und ein bisschen herb. Der Geschmack ist ähnlich wie das Aroma. Ein bisschen bittere ist vorhanden, die Karbonisierung passt. Zusammengefasst ist es langweilig, aber ich trink auch nicht so gerne Kristall.
Aroma is tart earthy hay with citrus undertones. Flavor is tart apple with lemon notes and definite yeast. Body is light with quite a bit of carbonation.

Bottle in Berlin.
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma light malty, caramel, and hoppy. Flavor light sweet and bitt. Medium body. Boring.

Pale yellow clear body with white rockyhead. Aromas  banana, grains, hay. Palate is medium bodied with soft lively carbonation and mouthfeel. Middletaste sweet,  wheat malty and some fruitiness. Aftertaste sweet, grainy and dry. Finish is thin and wheaty with slightly hoppy end. Overall remind me agains of  Vollbier, the texture is thin, taste is mild but overall an ok Kristallweizen.

A nice example of an entry level Weizen. Its clear and golden with a lovely frothy head. It has light banana and a touch of phenol on the nose. the body is light and re-freshing. A decent beer..although nothing special.
Bottle. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast and a little banana. Flavour is malt, wheat, medium sweet, yeast, little banana, hop and a little bitter.
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and bubble gum. Flavor is medium sweet. Dry finish. Watery. 130312
Bottle. Clear golden with diminishing white head. Thin nose. Flavour has banana and very little else. Not really good enough.

Bottle - 500ml. Limpid blond body with a fair white creamy head. Decent malty/hoppy aroma with some subtle yeasty hints. Its well balanced taste carries yeasty notes and ends with a decent herbal/yeasty finish.

Golden yellow colour with a white head that sat and subsided. Aromas are of clove and banana and a little funk (this might just be the yeast, but a little off-putting). Plenty of carbonation as expected. Juicy and quenching with a mild banana bread flavour that doesnt hang around for long. Light, fluffy and ideal for after mowing the lawns.
An easy drinking Kristall.  Not overly flavoured with the banana and cloves that you can get with wheat beers.
grass, cereal, caramel, leather, cheese, rotten eggs, vanilla, alcohol, golden, sparkling, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, medium body, flat,

Good beer smell, if a bit mild. The flavor is nice, albeit weak; I wouldnt say diluted as it has a creamy mouthfeel and does feel more substantial than it is. Leaves no aftertaste, but has leaves a taste on the palate that I wouldnt necessarily call metallic, but it is pungent however mild it may be.

Very weak beer, but what there is to detect is good. A solid, refreshing beer, something to hydrate on rather than to sit and enjoy. Im rating it as a beer that you drink cold and fast, not as a beer with character. This is what Budweiser and all those shitty domestics should be.

500 mL bottle, poured into a weizen glass. Clear pale yellow body with a luscious, fluffy head, slow to dissipate. Moderate carbonation. Mild aroma. Thin body with refreshing, light undertones of wheat, grasses, slightly yeasty.
German crystal clear wheat beer with a good dishwashing foam and taste ok, but not as good as their heffe edition.
Bottle. Clear pale gold body with a huge billowing white head. Highly carbonated-effervscent. Aroma-taste: grain, bubblegum, clove, lemon with a sweetish body. Medium bodied.

Cristal clear golden color with a big and beautiful creamy white head that holds on very well.
Aroma shows the wheat with intensity. Starts off with banana and cereal but after a while some spices appear like coriander, aniseed and flowers.
Taste is also assertive with fruity sweetness balanced by some cereally notes and a bittersweet aftertaste. Classy.
Good medium body but the finish is a little abrupt. Smooth and classic wheat beer just like all the ones Ive tried from Schöfferhofer.

Bottle 500ml from Parkhill cellars. Nice yeasty nose. Aromas of caramel, citrus, and bread. Taste is sweet, with light sourness and light bitterness; average length. Palate is oily, and medium bodied. Dark yellow, with a frothy head.

500ml bottle (Stockmann, Tallinn)
5 Muted wheaty aroma, more a wheat ale than a kristallweizen.
3 Gold, big light tight head.
5 Sweet wheaty body, not like a hefe withough hefe though. A bit plasticky.
2+ A bit watery and sweet. Papery hop finish. Late finish a little cornflakey and sweet.
8 Nothing really wrong with this, but it really doesnt deliver what I was after at the time. I prefer my kristalls to be closer to being their hefe minus the hefe.
Bottle -Slightly earthy with bubblegum and pineapple.slight Metallic taste , then bubblegum and a hint of grass.  Crisp dry finish.
A clear yellow beer with a huge head. Aroma is malty and yeaty, notes of banana. Taste is yeast and wheat. Clean and dry.
Egy eléggé átlagos német szűrt búza, de azért nagyon is ízletes és könnyen fogyasztható, nincs is értelme túlragozni.
Pours a clear yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma is a little wheaty with some banana and grass. Taste is wheat, sour yeast with some citrus. Dry finish. Not a great wheat.
Pours clear golden with a high head. Aroma is malts with some wheat. Flavor is quite well balanced with malts and wheat. Quite decent.
A slight taste of banana but nothing much more to it. Pours in a nice golden collour but overall disappointing.

Fruchtiger, leicht bananiger Antrunk, ab dem Mittelteil kan ma jedoch kaum noch erkennen, das die ein Weizen sein soll. Es ist dort herb, im Nachgeschmack bitter, beides lässt eher auf ein geschmacksarmes Pils schließen. Von Schöfferhofer hab ich eh nichts gutes erwartet - genau das wurde dann auch erfüllt... 
Besonders im Mittelteil und im Nachgeschmack schmeckt das Bier so flach, dass es eigentlich nur mit "schlecht" zu bezeichnen ist. 	 
Test vom 26.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 7,3,3,1,4,1 - 2,35

Bottle 50cl, a clear yellow beer with good had. Nose is weizen like and a bit hopy. Aroma is dry with low malty notes, bit astringent, metallic, low hops presence, bit papery. Body is watery but beer is easy drinkable.
50 cl bottle, Lund via Berlin. Pale gold, quickly dissapating head. bready lime aroma. Sweet flavour, caramel nuttiness. Finish has a sharp hoppiness, pepper with a lingering clove on the end.
sweet malty,golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, oily feel, soft carbonation, light bitter finish.

Pretty good but overly carbonated. Very lively but maintains a clean and refreshing mouthfeel because of it. Its very easy to drink, nice to a non hefe person. A good offering from Schofferhofer. I like this beer, not really fruity, not a lot of alcohol, a little bite from carb, but overall a clean light hefe that is nice to drink a few of

Pours clear golden yellow with huge white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is yeast, bananas, cereal, hops and hay. Crispy fruity mouthfeel. Sour-sweet, wheat, hoppy, yeasty and fruity flavor. Watery acidy fruity palate. Finishes acidy sour turning into dry tart hoppy.
Color clear yellow with medium head. Aroma citrus, yeast, bread. Taste citrus, grass, dry.
On tap at an Italian restaurant in Trier. Nice golden color, full head and strong carbination. Taste is pleasant - mild banana and wheat - not as intense as a Hefe, but easy to drink.

Looked and smelled good, but a little lacking in the flavor and body departments. Poured with a nice, large, white, thick, foamy, frothy head and some lace. Color is a clear yellow. Aroma is standard Bavarian weiss- malt, bananas, spices, bit of lemon. Flavor is where it gets a little shallow and has a bit of a metallic component. Body is good and carbonatioin is ok. Finish is like favor. Nothing too special here.

500 ML bottle in Germany. Pours a clear golden color with a very full white head. Aroma is of yeast and citrus. Mouth feel is very carby. Taste is weak and grassy. Palate is also weak but this is enjoyable but very plain.

500ml bottle.  Kristal clear rich orange gold hue, large white frothy slowly diminishing head, fair lacing.  Likable aromas of banana, clove, citrus, bread dough with yeast all meld together nicely.  Moderately sweet, mildly sour/acidic flavour.  Soft carbonation, medium body, creamy texture that lasts for ages stuck to my palate, eventually finishes dry & wheaty.  OK and was great for washing away the spiciness of the vindaloo curry I had prior to this.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is wheat, banana and clove. Flavour is wheat, butterscotch and banana.
Bottle. Light golden colour with a short lasting white head. Taste is vey mild and subtle with the usual hint of banana. Slightly disappointing

Bright and golden when poured with decent carbonation, average head. Bananas and cloves on the nose. Tastes a bit sweet but there is quite a nice fruity explosion as it leaves the tongue. This is a decent beer and I find it rather refreshing. Love it in summer sitting outside on the deck.
Bottle from The Cave. Golden colour, large white head. Nose of wheat and banana. Taste of wheat, some spicyness, banana, a bit bready.
Bottle. aroma with a slight  hint of banana. Light yellow colour, white head, Sweet, slightly bitter, citrus. Sparkling. Refreshing. Fine beer

Bottle.
A: Bright, golden, large creamy white head. Good carbonation
S: Ripe bananas, cloves. Not overwhelming, just nice.
T: Sweet, then slightly sour at the finish
P: Medium body, fizzy carbonation on tongue, 
O: Very pleasant beer overall. Nothing outstanding, but enjoyable.

Bottle:
Big foamy white head.
Smell is a good fresh mix of wheats, spices, hops and some fruits.
Color is golden yellow.
Taste a nice mix of fruits (lemon/citrus), wheats, hops and again nice freshness.
Perfect summer beer, like the hefeweizen. Drink it cold!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
average frothy white head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. sparkling dark yellow body. aroma: heavy yeasty, banana and clove. if: moderate sweet and bitter. ff: light sweet moderate bitter; average duration. palate: medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation metallic finish.forte gosto banana, rústica, mas saborosa, dulçor no ponto, mais amarga que a média

Nota: 40 skol

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Citrus aroma with a hint of banana. Yellow colour, white head, good lace. Sweet, bitter, citrus, light grainy/malty. Crisp and sparkling. Refreshing, clean. Normally Kristallweizen isnt my style as many good things from the Hefe are missing. But this one is OK.

50cl bottle from Aktiv Markt Trier. Clear golden colour, a bit darker than the Eis-Kristall, white head. Sweet aroma of banana, light grainy notes, some cloves. Flavour is light sweet, light grainy, wheat, some banana, prickly light sour/bitter finish. Watery texture, prickly mouthfeel. Ligth to medium bodied.

Bottle with thanks to a local C-5 crew and their New Years charity!  Classic pour of bright, clear golden beer with a skyscraper of tight white foam on top.  The aroma is crisp and malty, but a hint of soap cannot escape my first impression.  It drinks with a slick mouthfeel.  The flavors are muted but resonate with a very light banana creme and sweet malt.  Enjoyable.  (#3782, 1/1/2010)

500ml bottle at Alt-Berliner Weissbierstube. Clear golden with a bubbly ring around the rim of the glassware. Mild weissen aroma of banana and clove. Discreet taste character of sweet, late fruits plus bready malts. Rounded mouth feel. In fine interplay with the Weissbierstube salad (Berlin, 23.11.2009).

Tasted alongside Schneider Weisse Kristall. Typical Hefeweizen aroma with a good dose of citrus. Very high carbonation and finishes quite dry and sharp compare to the Schneider. Also lacking the depth in body compared to the schneider weiss.

500ml bottle from First Choice Liquor. Pours clear golden with a transient medium white head. Aromas of fresh bread and lemon citrus. Palate is medium bodied with wheat, lemon and banana flavours. Finishes moderately sweet. Quite highly carbonated with a lively mouthfeel. A decent German filtered wheat beer that is reasonably priced in Australia.

(bottle)  A brilliantly clear Kristallweizen, somehow not as flavourful as its Hefeweizen brother.  Looks like this is one beer that lost something during the filtration process.  I still liked it though, and would drink again.

Bottle 50cl. @ home.Clear medium yellow color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light malty, moderate yeasty, light banana, sour yeast, acotone. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light acidic with a average duration, fresh acidic notes. Body is medium, texture is creamy to watery, carbonation is soft. [20091005]

Bottle, bought @ CITTI, Flensburg.
Pours clear pale golden with a fine, creamy, white head. Sweet wheaty aroma, light citric and banana a tad sugary. Highish carbonation, fair mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, light metallic, some citric. Actually a kinda fine kristall weizen.

Bottled 500ml. -Pale golden coloured, medium sized white head that went away slowly, pleasant wheaty spicy nose. Lively carbonation. Slight wheaty and quite stale acidic taste with notes of bubblegum and metal. A bit watery palate.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado (thanks!) Poured a clear yellow-golden body pierced by very lively carbonation and a big thick white head. Cloves and bubblegum in the nose. Smooth taste, chewed up bubblegum ending with lemony sourness. A bit bready too. Ok enough, kinda drinkable.
I dont know whats the deal with the Kristall hefe weizen but I just dont find the good taste in it. This one was not the exception.
Bottle. Huge head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, malt, banana and hops.
Sampled in Berlin. A really good weizen. Pours golden with a bit of cloudiness. A really well made brew, refreshing, limiited aftertaste. Well done.

A light nutty, banana aroma. The color is amber, clear, with a minimal head.  Used about 250mL in a marinade for a brisket that I smoked last weekend.  The rest I drank while smoking said brisket.  Both the beer and the meat were satisfying not something Ill be doing every weekend.
good sweet malty smell with some yeast. moderate lacing. taste of sweet malts, banana, bread, and a slight hop bite. Descent beer that Id drink again but I wont go out of my way to do it.

Dark yellow head with little white head. Lively carbonation. Fruity aroma with obvious wheat and some spices, thin banana also here. Medium bodied, smooth palated. Flavor is also fruity with same spices, aftertaste dries with dominating lemon and banana. Well, refreshing, but rather dull one.
Clear and sparkling golden colour with a huge rocky head. Good lacing on the glass. Strong wheat aroma and taste.
Clear godlen with huge offwhite head. Sweet yeasty and wheaty aroma. Flavour is sweet with yeasty, banana and wheaty notes. Finished sweet.

500ml Bottle. Pours dark yellow with a nice head and appears very gassy. Aromas of lemon, banana and hops. A hoppy flavour, slightly metallic, orange and hint of malt. Slight bitterness. 
Gassy, yet soft palate.
A bit watery and leaves an oily finish. Not as good as its unfiltered counterpart.
At trinkgut boland Kleve Kellen Germany, Golden, Medium head, some ctrus, and banana, little body, very fresh but thin kristal.
This is a good starter kristall and goes well with a meal.  This is lighter than the Heffe- but has the same tastes.

Golden  and sparkling witha  fluffy white head that quicky dissappears. Lively Carbonation that just keeps coming.

Sweet aroma of fruit and a slight citrus tinge. Flavour of Bannana are most present with an aftertaste of citrus and sherbet. 

Dry to the mouth and bitter on the palate.  
Good but not great, this is not the best example of a Kristall

...bottle.  Clove, citrus and hints of bananna on the nose with some wheat.  Pours a clear golden yellow, with a nice puffy white head, and lively carbonation that lasts untill the end.  Flavors are subtle compared to the unfiltered version, with a lighter body and less creamy consistancy.  Still a good brew with wheat malt, clove, citrus and some slight hop notes coming through.  Finishes dry, but lacks the flavor of the original.  That is always the case with any kristal, the beer must be unfiltered for the true full flavor experience.  That goes for any wheat based beer if you want maximum flavor. Still very drinkable and good, but go for the normal hefe.
Bottle. Poured clear golden, fluffy white head. Banana bubblegum nose. Flavours of banana, sweet zest, slight bitterness. Otherwise pretty weak watery beer.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and yellow with a huge almost fully white head. Ester banana aroma. Flavour starts sweet with a distinct ester flavour of banana - followed by a brief more citric note. Goes gradually more dry towards the finish. Ends dry wheaty.

Botella. Golden colour with a nice white good lasting head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and some fruits. Quite good a mouthfeel. The flavour is fresh with wheat and some yeast along with some bananas, malt and citrus.
Golden, clear, white head. Good carbonation. Fresh aroma and flavour. Wheat, yeast and vague notes of bananas. Some malty sweetness. Very drinkable.

Bottled.
Fruit, banana, some citrus, very refreshing, but perhaps less of a mouth feel than in the hefe version. Go for the hefe if you have the choice.

Bottled at Zum Letzten Instanz, Berlin. Clear golden, long-lasting white head. Fruity with some spicy and estery banana notes. Moussy mouthfeel. Well balanced, dry finish. A good Kristallweizen, almost as good as the unfiltered version.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2008 (Bottle at Zur Letzten Instanz, Berlin)On June 7, 2008Clear golden color, fluffy whte head. Buttery malty sweet taste, also banana. Fruity, sweet and banana scent. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.6/4/7/3/13=3.3RerateOn August 2, 2008(50 cl bottle brought home by a friend form Germany)Golden color, white head. Malty and estery banana scent and taste. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness. One of the better Kritall I’ve had.6/4/6/3/12=3.1Medium rating: 6/4/6/3/13=3.2
Pours a nice golden yellow.  Aromas of of citrus, fruit,  and a little yeasty.  Flavor is crips, almost pilsner like.  A little hops at the end.

Clear golden with a nice head. Both aroma and flavour has more to offer than the average kristall. I find light sweetness and a good banana note, there is no clear clove and/or yeast, but that is low in the rest of the Schöffenhofer series too. Not as nice at the "normal" version, but better than expected.

Bottle. Poured clear golden yellow with little head. Banana esters on the nose, with maybe a hint of hops. Light bodied with plenty of carbonation. The flavour is a pleasant combination of some maltiness with wheat complexity: banasa, citrus and with some hoppy bitterness, especially in the finish. Overall, a pleasant drink.
Bottle: Poured a golden color with a white color head. Aroma is banana and bread. Taste is banana and yeast very interesting for a kristall.
500ml brown bottle. Light body, well-carbonated, wheaty flavor with a slight banana character. Late slightly dry finish, very clean. OKAY
Nice frothy head on gold coloured beer,medium carbonation.Aroma grassy,lemon,wheat,malt.Flavour wheat,lemon,hop,barley sweetness,a little watery at the finish and boring taste.

Bottle. Very strong smell of banana, light citrus. Clear golden body, average white foamy head, normal long lasting. Light bitter start, then it gets more bitter, finally some citrus shines through. Dry, lively carbonation, light to medium body, moderate astringent finish.

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a big and moderately persistent foamy white head. Sweet wheat-malty nose with banana and shy notes of vanilla. Moderately sweet, slightly bitter flavour, slim bodied with a crispy carbonation. Wheaty and banana-fruity taste; almost dry, bitter-sweet finish with light hints of grassy hops. Slim and not very rounded (30.03.08).

bottle at franfurt airport. Crystal clear yellow with creamy rocky head, vigerous bubbles rising in the glass. Aromas of clove, mild pepper. Flavor is sweet bubblegum finishing towards grassy grainy and some metal. mouthfeel is lacking. Pretty uninspiring stuff.

Found this the other day in Okinawa! Imagine that! Anyway, pours out a clear yellow with a massive billowing white head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty with lemon, nutmeg, banana, and bubblegum sweetness. Taste is also very sweet, maybe a bit too much. Very refreshing as lemon and nutmeg mix with fizzy carbonation. Light palate and mouthfeel  but not too bad at all!

Bottle, Melbourne (very sizable 500ml ! ). Very frothy witbier which is probably more solid in body than most. (lager-ish?) Fairly carbonated with good head. Very approachable wheaty beer, a little sweet, good flavour the way through. Aftertaste is subtle wheat, lingering, plesant if unremarkable.
Bottle. Poured a golden clear sparkling. Aroma is wheat and lemon. Taste is carbonated and very wartery.
At the Franfkurt airport because they had nothing else but Bitburger, pours like champagne with tight bubbled head. Clean and crisp but rather bland.
50cl bottle.  Pours a clear yellow colour with a medium, frothy white head.  Small fizzy carbonation.  Very soft aroma of banana, spice and faint chalk.  Decent kristalklar.
Ein wirklich leckeres, gut trinkbares Bier, obwohl ihm natürlich einiges zu einem guten Hefeweizen fehlt. Aber da kann man drüber wegsehen.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2007 Bottle (500ml). Poured a very pale/golden yellow with a creamy, frothy large white head which was mostly diminishing. Aroma was nice and big with large amounts of ripe banana, some cinnamon, cloves and some sweet weatyness present. Taste was initially sweet with very slight acidity, followed by over ripe bananas and some vanilla in the background. Light to medium bodied with a super filtered/watery mouthful and fizzy carbonation, average finish with a chalky reminisce left in the mouth.

Big white shiny lasting head. Clear yellow body with carbonation. Very faint banana aroma. Dry soft yet sharpish malty banana taste with the Schöfferhofer signature ash background. Clean. Dry lemony ash aftertaste. Not bad. (0.5l bottle at Zills Tunnel, Leipzig.)

500ml bottle in a pack from Aldi. £7 for 5 bottles (mix of Kristall and Heffe) and the glass. The glass is great. Nice shape, and a good heavy bottom, with plenty of room at the top for foamy beers. This beer doesnt foam much. In fact this beer doesnt do much at all. Its a lager for sure. Thats the first thing. The wheat aspect comes next - but not heavy. Bubblegum nose, with notes of palma violets in the taste along with bananas. Hops are a smudgy bitterness late in the finish coming back with a mild burn. Crisp forced carbonation can be rather intrusive. Its a drinkable beer though - even if not up to much. Its a wheat beer for those who dont really like wheat beers.
Bottle. Clear golden colour. Thinnish body, malty taste. Reasonably spicy aroma - cloves/ coriander/ cinnamon? Much prefer the Hefeweizen.

Bottle. Frothy white excellent mostly deminishíng head. Pale yellow colour. Light malty and yesty aroma. Week fruity esters but they are detectable. Light bitter hefe flavor. Average finish. Watery palate.
Wow Ive never seen so much carbonation with a beer. Anyway a solid if unspectacular drop - the missing link between beer and champagne

Bottle. A clear, golden, quite sparkling beer with a dense, white head. Theres banana and some cloves in the aroma. The same goes for the flavor, but theres some citrus and wheat in it as well, and it is quite sweet. Medium body, and a quite short finish with banana and yeast. As usual, the kristall is a bit boring. (070805)
Clear and yellow. Has a lasting, white head. Aroma of some faint spicy notes, corinader? Flavor is mainly sweet and a bit spicy, ginger.
Bottle at Blackfriars, RBESG 2007.  Clear gold, lasting white head.  Banana aroma.  Good carbonation.  Crisp on finish.  Bit empty.  Malts.  Banana  Bit empty throughout but fine.

Bottle, Blackfriars, Glasgow, RBESG 07. Clear golden, with a thin white head. Hazy smelling metallic wheat. Sweetness. Banana strong. Quite metallic in the mouth with more banana, wheaty. Finishes sweet and metallic. Alright.
500ml bottle. Nice clear crisp colours, fair laced head. Complex subtle aromas of fruits, zesty and as touch of spice sweetness. Nice flavours, sweet fruits and nice wheat balance.

Pale see through pilsner yellow with lasting white head.  Aroma is graasy malty/wheaty.
Lively carbonation. taste has hints of wheat & banana. Just had maisels kristall and this one def. has a lot more flavor. Medium to light body. Good lacings. Banana, wheat & light yeast. actually OK!
Poured a decent hazy orange.  Lots of banana and cloves on the palate, but somehow felt it could be better.  Good beer though.

Keg on tap at Im Alten Zollhaus, 500ml, pasteurised. Gold with white head. Dry, bitter beer with a background fruitiness, touches of lemon / grapefruit, peely and tangy. Nicely refreshing in a pretty decent pub, just slightly out of the way.
Bottle. Pale gold, thick head. Wheat aroma. Nice taste of banana with a round finish of hops.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a nice mostly lasting creamy head. Aroma and taste of fruits, wheat with notes of citrus. stop filtering please!
Bottle from Berlin. Nice fluffy head. Rich golden body. Medium carbonation. Flavour is a bit watery, and has that chemical aftertaste I detected in the Hefe. Looks great but, not much there.
Bottle. Yellow color, white head. Fruity aroma, banana, pear, pine apple and some wheat. Bana flavor, some wheat and pear. A bit thin flavor, and with a mild malty finish.

Bottle at Connection at Frankfurt Airport. My first experience with this style is certainly a good one. It is really see through, amazing. Nice lemony taste, with a slice of lime in it. Grassy. Very enjoyable.

Bottle 500ml. Nice beer, flavor is good and as well as the aroma. Not could see the color because I drink in own bottle. Cerveja saborosa e com aroma forte, não posso falar da sua cor, pois bebi na própria garrafa.
A bright golden colour, with a light fruit wheat nose, and a smooth fruit wheat flavour

Beer 44 Summer 2006 trip in Europe.  Drank on 7/7/06 at The Bull and Bear Cafe and Bar in Frankfurt.  Had this on draft in .5L glass, served with a slice of lemon.  Very bubbly and constanly fizzy, but with a nice kick.  My first Kristallweizen.

Another great German beer,similar taste to Crown Lager, comes in a 500ml bottle
excellent value at $2.70 ea! Great tasting beer at and great value too!
Ill be buying these by the box in future.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit and yeast.

On tap in Kaiserslautern. Most people seem to prefer the hefeweizen and the dunkel to this one, but I think this is my favourite. The combination of bubbly refreshing draught of a quality lager and the rich taste of a nice wheat beer is pulled off really well here.

Bottle: Golden coloured, lively carbonation, firm rocky, slowly collapsing white head; mainly bananas in the aroma with a faint tinge of grassy hops (!); weak sweetish-bitter flavour; faint fruity (bananas again) finish with a light acidity, tartness and bitterness in the aftertaste. Unusual Kristall-Weizen, nearly a Weizen-Pils, but not a great pleasure.........
( Bottle / 500 ml, thanks Dolty ! ) Pyellow color with a medium white foam. Malt and fruit notes. Light bodied with a hint of bitterness in the finish. Not bad for a kristallweizen !

50 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Golden clear colour with a nice fizzy white head. Light soft aroma of wheat and yeast. Flavour of wheat, citrus, yeast and a pretty bitter hop finish at the end. Little unusually for this type. But still easy to drink.

Bottled  Fizzy, white, fully diminishing head.  Clear, yellow body.  Hoppy and yeasty aroma, quite intersting.  Moderately sweet, lightly bitter initial flavour.  Lightly sweet, lightly bitter finish.  Lightly bodied.  Quite sweet and uninteresting weizen.
From 500 ml bottle in Wurtzburg, Germany. Poured a cloudy yellow with nice medium white head. God nose of hops, wheat, and fruit. Flavor is decent.  Very light and refreshing.
500 ml bottle.  Clear golden appearance, medium head with nice consistant bubbles.  Fruity hoppy aromas.
[bottle from peckhams] Aroma has notes of wheat, yeast notes,  banana and spice are less pronounced than the hefe (obviously). palate is watery and thin. kristallweizens are rubbish.
Aroma is lightly wheaty honey malts. Taste is light but quite drinkable, grassy hops see to be making a wee appearance too.

500 mL, thanks IslandHaole! Clear straw.  Thin, white head fed by a constant stream of small bubbles.  Strong, wheat aroma with honey covered grains and a light bitterness.  Watery palate that has a crisp feel in the mouth with no real disagreeable flavoursthough lacking real depth, there is some nice toasted gain and light maltsdecent at best.

Bottled.  A clear golden pour, foamy white head.  Wheaty aroma.  Not a lot of flavor at all, a little wheat here and a little tart citrus there.  Lots of carbonation.  Light body (read: thin), slightly bitter aftertaste, but only barely.  Not a bad beer at all, just very uninteresting.  Would be a fine choice for a warm summer day.

Clear gold, foamy head with good retention. Bananas and sweet spice aroma. Wheaty palate without being estery, vanilla, banana, and orange peel with a little sweet spice. Im not the biggest fan of wheat beers, but I liked this one.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: My first Kristall! Clear Golden with a fine-bubbled, foamy, cream colored head. Typical Weizen scent, bananas very prominent. Sweet wheaty flavor with some perfumy traces in the follow. Burp inducing carbonation, slightly thin. Id term this a "breakfast beer". Innofensive, slightly sweet, easy to drink.

(Bottle 50 cl) Clear and golden with a huge head. Im not a great fan of Kristalls, but this is one of the better samples. Fresh, dry almost crispy. And a bit unusually it is very wheaty with a citrusy edge. 081000
Bottle. Metallic aroma. Clear golden colour, stable rocky white head. Flavour is like can be expected from a Kristallweizen, a bit boring. But quite bitter for a wheat beer, and a bit harsh.

500 ml bottle.  Pale golden coloured, transparent beer.  Thick, persistent white head.  Faint clove, bubble gum, but no banana esters.  Flavour is okay, bubble gum, apple and a touch of wheat.  Pale bready malt is quite prominent.  Fairly thin body and slightly acidic.

An absolute quaffer. Poured a decent head, but quite quick to disappear to a minimal level that is supplied from its high level of fizz. Typical aroma of banana and bubblegum. Flavour is sweet with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Very light bodied and thin with plenty of fizz. I am sure on a warm summers day the 500ml would go down in a flash, but its just a bit on the weak side for me.

As far as filtered wheat beers go this isnt a bad drop. Suited more to a quaffer than a sipper, but it seemed very clean and showed reasonable balance. Poured into a tall stein, a high amount of fine carbonation pushed up a decent 2" fluffy white head that left a good lace. The body, a clear straw. Sweet bubblegum, banana and tangy wheat in the aroma with a little spicy phenols coming through.  Quite subdued in the mouth considering the good smelling intro. Lemons, bubblegum and clean malt, banana and citrus notes throughout, quite watery and thin on the palate. Became quite gummy in the swallow as I downed it and it slowly warmed. Still quite refreshing and nothing truly bad about it.
Blonde and clear. Somewhat flowery aroma. Some banana and glue in the flavor. A bit bland for a weizenbier, but nothing wrong with aroma and flavor. Its not bad, its just boring.
Clean and clear amber color... not-so-filling as Hefeweizen, crisp taste. Typically lively carbonation... Minimal head tends to disappear quickly after a sip or two.
Not bad.  Very clean and inoffensive style. Nice faint wheat notes overlaid with a larger feel.  Good thirst quencher style.  Hard to get too excited however.

Cant say Im a fan of the style, but this seems a particularly insipid take on it. Clear gold in the glass, decent head. Light aroma of yeast and a hint of banana. Flavour is also very restrained - wheat, some sweet malt. (Bottle)
An hazy orange beer with a disappearing white head. The aroma is sweet and dominated by banana. The flavor is very wheaty with notes of banana and a thin body.
Pale yellow colour with big white head. Aroma has a sweet maltyness with some fruit and spices. Flavor is sweet with hints of bubble-gum. Average Kristallweizen but refreshing.
Bottle. Golden color with a white head. Yeasty light fruity aroma and yeasty appel taste. Light body and a sweet thin finish.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2007 Bottled. Golden coloured. Quite clear. Off white dense head. Sweetness, light yeast, light fruits and light metallic. Flavour is sweetish and bananaish. Quite smooth and mild. Light bodied. Is yeasty and fresh in the end. Original Rate Bottled (6-2-6-2-11): Very light yellow. Huge white dense head. There is some spices, citrus, yeast, light fruit and malt to be noticed in aroma as well as flavour. Aroma is a little more vague, than I like. Is quite thin, and dosnt last long on your palate. Is quite fresh. Uninteresting.

Bottle. Nice golden coloured beer with a thick white head. Aroma is spicey, citrus, slightly metallic and yeasty. Flavour is wheaty, citrusy and bubblegum. Medium bodied and quite highly carbonated. Pretty good.
Compared to the other great selections offered under the Schofferhofer moniker, this one is not so great.  However, when compared to other german kristalweizens, this one is quite good.

On tap at the Onyx Bar on Friedrichsplatz in Mannheim (www.onyx-mannheim.de). Clear yellow  with a monstrous white head. Carbonation more evident than the hefe. Less malt flavor than the dunkles, however I really thought that this was quite good because I could taste the yeast freshness of this lager. Throughout Germany, I found (counter to my personal beer creedo) that the "lightest" beer was the most interesting.
Bottled.  Boring golden colour almost clear to the beer with a lovely aroma of bananas, bubblegum and smooth wheatiness.  The taste is quite average typically weizen but by no means offensive.  OK

Not much aroma - hint of yeast.  Flavor nothing unique - very little body on this beer - only a slight hint of the typical fruit / clove flavor with a sour finish but okay for a Kristall.  Probably not the best choice unless its the only Weizen you can get.

hint of alcohol (strange considering only 5%abv) biscuity, citrus and bubblegum.
light golden, small head, low carbonation.
spicy, citrusy, biscuity and grassy flavours.
dry, spicy, citrusy bitterness moving to refreshing, clean palate.
not bad, but nothing special either.
Pleasant golden, very clear with nice blossoming head. Aroma is of spicey lemony hops with clove and banana yeastyness. flavour is spicey again with a little green banana and nice lemony aftertaste.

Flat looking yellow straw colour with a large frothy head that was mostly lasting. Aroma of banana, vanilla, cloves and soap(yeast?).Taste was good with the banana following through, cloves as well, with an oily dry texture and soft carbonation giving a chalky like mouthfeel. Medium body with an average length finish. Cheers!
Apples and pears with some cinnamon thrown in. Big aroma. Very unique and has a lighter feel than the other. Pretty good though.

Nice but bland aroma. Some clove, a bit of wheat and some vanilla ice cream. Flavour is the definition of bland, just boring and watery as hell. Lacking that nice malt sweetness a Weizen needs. Pours with a nice big head and then disappears to nothing.
Aroma has fairly distinct wheat volatiles that definately carry through to the flavour. Pours a clear yellow. Strong wheat flavour with a bitter hop aftertaste. Nothing wrong with this at all.
decent foamy head, and a yellow/brown colour. crystal clear. quite gassy, and dry al the way through. a bit cidery at the end. a tiny little bit biscuity. a tiny little bit of bitterness. banana.

This was, from memory, my first German wheat beer and I have to say that I was fairly impressed.


The flavour and aroma were not terribly noticeable but at least weren't unpleasant. I guess I'll become accustomed to them with a little more wheat beer experience.


My cold 500ml. bottle, when poured into a flute, produced a nice fluffy head which persisted for some time and also produced pretty vigorous bubbles which together added a nice overall effect.


A nicer beer than it's individual components might suggest. I shall however need to compare it to other wheats before I can decide for sure on the flavour/aroma.

Light pleasant wheaty nose, pale gold-yellow color and a fizzy, but low head. Mainly a citrusy taste with hops or bitter. Napkiny aftertaste well after the swallow. Thin, odd balance - not well blended or timed flavor profile.
Banana apple taste. Golden with a liveley carbonation and a little head. Spicey and hoppy but somehow an wired aftertaste. Thin and not typical for an Kristallweizen. MmmH
Very disappointing. A light uninspiring wheat beer with subtle everything, fruit, hops and body. Insipid colour too.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: Large white foam and clear golden body. Aroma and taste-wise this beer does not have much to offer; seems like an uninteresting pilsner mixed with an average wheat beer. Boring but drinkable.
Light golden with a taller white head.  Light bananas aroma.  Clean and uneventful, very much a kristall.
Nice looking pale golden color with a medium short lasting head. Crisp and bitter, a great wheat beer. Must be chilled as it warmed the flavours became to skunky.
Nice golden color but no flavor at all.
Unlike the Hefeweizen this filtered so not so cloudy but still has nice golden colour. pours with huge creamy head, similar hoppy wheat aroma.
Golden yellow soft froth. Unlike other wheaties, clear and sweet. Clean bitter with smooth cloying middle and sweet finish. Beautiful if but a bit boring.

(Rated 14/5/02: Mainz, Germany)
Yet another pale yellow  healthy urine coloured beer with a medium cream coloured medium lasting head.  Hops and faint grassy meadows in the aroma. Medium body and palate with faint sweet, and stronger bitter flavours in the middle and refreshing clean bitter finish.
(Rated 14/5/02: Mainz, Germany)
OK but nothing special.
Big head, kristall gold colour, pleasant enough good wheat beer. The hefeweizen is far superior
Not bad but not as good as hefeweizen. Found it a little more hoppier, but not as smooth as hefeweizen, without the same great head retention and with a hint of skunkiness.

Kristall golden colour with a tall rocky white head.  Pleasantly subdued banana aroam and crisp, clean wheat flavour with some slight fruitiness.  If I had to describe this beer in one word I would use subdued.  It has all the good charecteristics of a weizen, but nothing really makes too much of an impression.  A good well balanced, easy to drink session beer.
I dont know how this was the grand champion beer for 2001 for a straight forward wheat beer.
Kind of bland really, ended up tasting like a straight forward lager, pretty boring in the end.

High speed beer.
Looks like the first slash of the day!
Good but not the same quality as the hefe at the same price.
Lacks classic Weissbier qualities. A waste of good wheat.
The apperarance was the best thing: Light with a big head.Below average.
the least inspiring schofferhofer.
